description: Automotive safety system V-Model example with ISO 26262 compliance

inputs.projectRequirements:
Develop software for an Advanced Driver Assistance System (ADAS) - Lane Keeping Assist:

1. Lane Detection
   - Process camera feed to detect lane markings
   - Detect left and right lane boundaries
   - Lane detection confidence level calculation
   - Update rate: 20 Hz (50ms)
   - Detection range: 3-100 meters ahead
   - Handle various road conditions (dry, wet, snow)

2. Vehicle Position Calculation
   - Calculate vehicle position within lane
   - Measure lateral deviation from lane center
   - Calculate heading angle relative to lane
   - Precision: ±5cm lateral position

3. Steering Intervention
   - Calculate corrective steering torque
   - Apply gentle steering corrections to keep vehicle centered
   - Maximum torque: 3 Nm
   - Smooth torque application (no sudden jerks)
   - Driver can override at any time

4. System Activation/Deactivation
   - Activate when: speed > 60 km/h, lane markings detected, driver hands on wheel
   - Deactivate when: speed < 55 km/h, lane markings lost, driver override detected
   - Visual indicator of system status (off, standby, active)
   - Audible alert on deactivation

5. Safety Monitoring
   - Camera health monitoring
   - Sensor plausibility checks
   - Steering actuator monitoring
   - Watchdog monitoring of all critical functions
   - Fail-operational mode: degrade gracefully

6. Driver Monitoring
   - Hands-on-wheel detection via steering torque sensor
   - Alert driver if hands off wheel >15 seconds while system active
   - Escalating warnings: visual → audible → system deactivation

7. CAN Bus Communication
   - Receive vehicle speed, steering angle, wheel speeds
   - Send steering torque commands
   - Send system status messages
   - CAN message rate: 10ms for critical signals

8. Diagnostic and Logging
   - Log all system events and interventions
   - Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs) for faults
   - Data recording for incident analysis
   - Interface with vehicle diagnostic system (OBD-II)

9. Safety Requirements (ISO 26262 ASIL B)
   - Hazard analysis and risk assessment (HARA)
   - Functional safety requirements
   - Safety mechanisms: plausibility checks, redundancy, monitoring
   - Fault detection and handling
   - Fail-safe behavior on critical faults

10. Non-Functional Requirements
    - Latency (detection to steering): <100ms
    - Availability: >99.9% when conditions allow
    - Operating temperature: -40°C to +85°C
    - Vibration resistance: per ISO 16750
    - EMC compliance: per ISO 11452
    - MISRA C compliance
    - AUTOSAR architecture

traceability.safetyGoals: Complete traceability from hazards to safety mechanisms
traceability.compliance: ISO 26262 work products and traceability matrix

learningPoints: ASIL B safety requirements and decomposition
Fault injection testing and fail-safe behavior
AUTOSAR architecture and MISRA C compliance
